DataElement.preferredDefinition: The question which asks which specific type of body tissue is being used to examine for laboratory testing and/or examination.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Specimen; a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes._A subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Specimen; a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes.

Concepts.definition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Property.preferredDefinition: A subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities._The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place._The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place._A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis._A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis._The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm. (NCI): An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.

Concepts.definition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.
An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.

PermissibleValues.value: Snap-frozen tumor tissue from Metastatic site
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Tumor Tissue Quick Freeze Metastatic Neoplasm

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Tumor Tissue Quick Freeze Metastatic Neoplasm
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A tumor sample, or entire tumor that is removed for microscopic examination.: To freeze rapidly so as to preserve structure and prevent ice crystal formation.: A tumor that has spread from its original (primary) site of growth to another site, close to or distant from the primary site.  Metastasis is characteristic of advanced malignancies, but in rare instances can be seen in neoplasms lacking malignant morphology.

Concepts.definition: Tissue sample that contains an abnormal cellular infiltrate forming a solid mass. The abnormal cellular component can be benign or malignant. Tumor samples are obtained for microscopic examination and/or molecular analysis.
To freeze rapidly so as to preserve structure and prevent ice crystal formation.

A tumor that has spread from its original (primary) site of growth to another site, close to or distant from the primary site.  Metastasis is characteristic of advanced malignancies, but in rare instances can be seen in neoplasms lacking malignant morphology.

PermissibleValues.value: Snap-frozen tumor tissue from Primary site
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Quick Freeze Tumor Tissue Primary Site of Disease

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Quick Freeze Tumor Tissue Primary Site of Disease
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: To freeze rapidly so as to preserve structure and prevent ice crystal formation.: A tumor sample, or entire tumor that is removed for microscopic examination.: The primary site of a disease of interest.

Concepts.definition: To freeze rapidly so as to preserve structure and prevent ice crystal formation.

Tissue sample that contains an abnormal cellular infiltrate forming a solid mass. The abnormal cellular component can be benign or malignant. Tumor samples are obtained for microscopic examination and/or molecular analysis.
The anatomic location where a disease of interest originated.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The fluid that is excreted by the kidneys.  It is stored in the bladder and discharged through the urethra.

Concepts.definition: The fluid that is excreted by the kidneys.  It is stored in the bladder and discharged through the urethra.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: On or near an edge or constituting an outer boundary; the outer area.: A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood.

Concepts.definition: On or near an edge or constituting an outer boundary; the outer area.

A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Refers to a process where a sample is preserved with formalin and then embedded into a paraffin block for sectioning.: Refers to preserved specimens embedded in support material.  These are typically cut into thin slices for microscopic examination, with or without an enhancement such as staining.

Concepts.definition: Refers to a process where a sample is preserved with formalin and then embedded into a paraffin block for sectioning.
Refers to preserved specimens embedded in support material.  These are typically cut into thin slices for microscopic examination, with or without an enhancement such as staining.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Body tissue, region, surface, cavity, fluid, organ, or collection of organs.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.:The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

Concepts.definition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.
The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueDomain.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form
